title: How to give your electronic projects a professional looking finish
speaker: Peter Miller
description: This talk is a ‘how-to’ or recipe to make your electronic projects look professionally finished. It will cover simple graphic design and small-scale metalwork with hand tools. The emphasis is on the techniques useful for personal making and hobby use.

title: An Evening of Unnecessary Detail
speaker: Matt Parker & Guests
description: ”An Evening of Unnecessary Detail” is an event where we ask enthusiasts, scientists, and/or comedians to talk about whatever they want. By attending this event, you revoke all rights to complain about the level of detail they choose to do so in.

title: The Role of Media in Impact Campaigns
speaker: Benn Wiebe
description:
Special event - Talk followed by secret film screening

What do impact campaigns accomplish in the creative landscape, and what is the role and responsibility of the media in driving that social impact? Inspired by the film "Don't Look Up", where Benn p

title: Electronic Music Open Mic (EMOM) Showcase
speaker: EMF Live Music
description:
Following on from the Electronic Music Open Mic session in Null Sector on Saturday afternoon, a few of the best performers are heading to the big stage to play short ten-minute sets!

If you'd like to take part in the afternoon session come along to Nul

title: Tiny Whooping A Circus Tent
speaker: Andrew Hyams
description:
This is a workshop by London Aerospace Village
Miniscule FPV racing drones flying round one of the big tents
Small and safe enough to lose a fight with a party balloon or your face
Fast and aerobatic enough to be entertaining (between crashes too!)
Co

title: QbagYbbxHc with Benn Wiebe
speaker: EMF Film
description: Come see a mystery film! We are not allowed to publicise this but we can say it's a fantasic, funny satire on mainstream media and politics. Benn Wiebe, who was an associate producer and climate consultant on "Don't Look Up" will deliver an introductory t

title: Graham Dunning - Mechanical Techno
speaker: EMF Live Music
description:
Graham Dunning's work explores sound as texture, timbre and something tactile, drawing on bedroom production, tinkering and recycling found objects.

Mechanical Techno uses a standard DJ turntable as a sequencer, sound source and ramshackle engine, buil

title: Feral Five and Jonathan Hogg present Truth Is The New Gold
speaker: EMF Live Music
description:
Dazzling electronic duo Feral Five and artist/technologist Jonathan Hogg present a glittering interactive audiovisual performance of Truth Is The New Gold, unique to EMF.

Use #emftruth on Mastodon to share your thoughts on truth for the show.

It’s a

title: Shirobon
speaker: EMF Live Music
description:
I'm Shirobon, I make music using video game consoles and stuff!

https://www.youtube.com/@ShirobonTV/featured
https://shirobon.bandcamp.com
https://linktr.ee/shirobon

title: Colossus: The Forbin Project
speaker: EMF Film
description: Join us for a brilliant late-night movie, a seventies classic and eerily prescient given the current rise of AI. Thinking this will prevent war, the US government gives an impenetrable supercomputer total control over launching nuclear missiles. But what

title: Yaxu - Live coding / auto-live coding
speaker: EMF Live Music
description: An algorave-style live coding performance from the movement's aging co-founder Yaxu (aka Alex McLean), using the new, accessible and free/open source Strudel live-coding environment (https://strudel.cc). This improvised from-scratch performance will inclu

title: Psychiceyeclix
speaker: EMF Live Music
description:
Psychiceyeclix performs wearing a robot synth helmet using unique instruments & circuit bent devices, using hacked games consoles/toys & diy electronics to create anything from drone, glitch, noise to drum & bass.

https://youtu.be/Kga5pK69WqI?si=3JIkPd

title: Stage Volunteer Training
speaker: EMF Stage Team
description: A training session for people who want to volunteer for stage & video roles, you'll learn how to do basic sound & video mixing, how the cameras work, and how to control the lighting.

title: Synthercise - the dance fitness experience
speaker: zooleika (aka Jo Walsh)
description:
Get ready to enjoy Synthercise, a dance fitness experience like no other - think "Zumba, but with chiptunes". 8-bit sounds, 90s oriented tunes.  

Come dressed in comfortable clothes, and shoes suitable for dancing and working out in - ready to shake yo

title: Lessons learned Open Sourcing the UK's Covid Tracing App
speaker: Terence Eden
description:
On the 7th of May 2020, six-weeks after lockdown was announced, the source code for the UK's COVID-19 contact tracing app was published on GitHub.

This is the story of how Open Source helped save lives.

Come and learn about how we convinced the NHS

title: Science Magic...Magic Science
speaker: Ian B Dunne
description:
To spell bind the audience, gasp, wonder and laugh. 

Demonstrations, the eerie strange sound of the theremin and it's analogue, the musical saw. Resonance, levitating objects,  and the occasional funny smell, now accompanied by Robots, Hugi, Tibbles an

title: From Makerspace to Outer Space
speaker: Neil Monteiro
description:
Going for a job in the space industry may seem like a moonshot but it's actually much closer than most people think - and a makerspace is a great place to start from. 

I now work in the space industry but began my journey into engineering just six year

title: I FOI'd every NHS board in England on autism assessment provision: here's how it went
speaker: Georgia Harper
description: In December 2023, 172,022 people were waiting for an autism assessment. We know this because NHS England publish quarterly national and regional statistics on the size of the waiting list. What we *don't* know is how long they're waiting for, how many ult

title: Practicalities of being a walking lightshow
speaker: doop
description: Festooning your clothes or costume with lots of glowy lights is fun. Making the glowy lights survive hours or days on end of dancing in sweaty raves or muddy festivals is harder. In this talk I discuss several ways of being a walking lightshow, the unfort

title: Unlimited Power: An Engineer's Low-Down on Nuclear Fusion Technology
speaker: James Pope
description: Most technical people hear about fusion power in the news or see it in games and movies, and are familiar with the joke that it's always 20 years away. Beyond this, it's surprisingly rare to find good information beyond the basic physics and the marketing

title: Where is the Art? A history in Technology
speaker: Andy Piper
description: In October 1971, Frieder Nake published an article in Page, the Bulletin of the Computer Arts Society, entitled "There Should Be No Computer Art", making the point that there were more important things for humans to work on together in the late Twentieth

title: Making sense of London Underground's timetables and real-time data
speaker: Arturs Dobrecovs
description:
Building on a talk by eta from EMF 2022, this is a deeper dive into how to make use of London Underground's real-time data and hard-to-access timetables to predict a train's future actions.

I will be going into depth on what is and isn't useful about T

title: Activism in Games, plus a Hopepunk RPG (Role-Playing Game)
speaker: Jennifer Estaris
description:
Resistance, systemic change, and our sustainable future can – and must – be playful! To quote the activism artist group Guerilla Girls: “If you can make someone who disagrees with you laugh, you're in their brain, and you can change minds.”

The speaker

title: Lightning talks  (Sunday)
speaker: Thor
description: Short 10 minute talks on any topic

title: Bringing Any Super 8 Camera Into The Digital Age
speaker: Jenny List
description:
This talk will describe the development process for a digital cartridge to fit any Super 8 home movie camera without any modifications required.

There are a huge number of unused 8mm home movie cameras that have been languishing unloved for the last fo

title: BIG PIPES! A dive into Scotland's hidden underground hydroelectric infrastructure 🌊
speaker: Andrew Simpson
description: A look at the history and construction of Scotland's hidden network of remote dams, tunnels, shafts and underground generating stations. Not many are aware of how extensive, ground-breaking, enduring and socially significant the hydro infrastructure hidde

title: An engineer’s guide to parenthood
speaker: Ella Barrington
description:
A lot has happened at the other end of life since the last EMF camp; pregnancy, birth and adjusting to life with a tiny human.

I am an engineer, so when two thin blue lines appeared and I found myself thrown into the chaos of pregnancy and parenthood,

title: Getting Started in Laser Cutting
speaker: Dominic Morrow
description: A presentational workshop with Q&A on getting started in Laser Cutting, diodes vs CO2, water cooling vs RF lasers. What is a Galvo Laser? Where to buy and what to expect? What different controllers are there? Which software exists and which to use for wha

title: CERN Technology: Following the White Rabbit down a 27km hole.
speaker: Laurence Stant
description: How does the most complicated machine in the world work? Why should we pay 16 billion euros to keep some physicists happy with a new toy? What has CERN ever done for us? What happens when you lose control of a beam the size of spaghetti with the energy of

title: Don't be evil by accident: algorithmic harms and ethics for technologists
speaker: Curtis Parfitt-Ford
description:
Technologists are wizards. Today, we wield the power to effect changes from a tent, a bedroom or an office the likes of which fifty years ago one might need the power of a small nation-state to accomplish.

Having seen these systems from all angles - bu

title: Creation of Number
speaker: Ben Sparks
description:
An entertaining journey through humanity’s mathematical attempts to wrestle with the deepest questions behind our day-to-day use of numbers, and their consequences.

Where do numbers come from?

Explore the philosophy of maths behind everyday examples

title: Contrary to popular belief, tech needs unions
speaker: United Tech & Allied Workers
description: It's no secret that the tech sector is notoriously lacking in unionisation compared to more traditional industries; We'd like to talk about why this might be, why it's a bad thing for everyone, and how we might go about fixing it.

title: Hebocon 2024
speaker: Jed Preist
description:
Hebocon is Robot Wars for those who are not technically gifted, or who would like to stop being technically gifted for a few hours.
Twirling assemblages of junk face off against hot glue monstrosities, whilst some contenders might fail to move at all.

title: Hack The Plan: How Being a Nerd-of-all-Trades is a Superpower
speaker: Kestral Gaian
description:
"So what do you do?"

Everything.

──────────

As a kid I couldn't decide what I wanted to be when I grew up.

I still can't, but over the past twenty years I've turned that into a superpower.

In this talk I'll tell you how I hacked the idea of

title: Badge Talk
speaker: The Badge Team
description: In which the badge team have a natter about the tildagon badge, the hexpansion format, the development process, pitfalls and panics along the way.

title: Astrophysics for Supervillains
speaker: Matthew Bothwell
description:
“Could you crash the Moon into the Earth?”
“If the Sun explodes, would we all get vaporized?”
“What’s the weather like on Mercury?”

Discover the answers to these questions (and many more!) at "Astrophysics for Supervillains"! Facts about space are al

title: Steaming into Sustainability
speaker: Ben Hussey
description: How do you get several three storey Cornish beam engines, a collection of Grade I listed buildings and a whole network of steam infrastructure on the path towards net zero? This talk is the experience of a volunteer on the practical challenges met whilst

title: Living on the canals of the UK - Lessons from the water
speaker: mark s brown
description:
The canals of the UK have undergone transformation from industry to decay to leisure and in recent years to housing. 

In this talk, we'll go through some of the history of this modern day shanty town along with lessons for any budding boaters consideri

title: So You Want To Hack On Rail Data: What's out there, and what can you do with it?
speaker: Gaelan Steele
description: The British rail industry publishes a lot of open data: there's at least 18 distinct data sources, plus the ones I'm forgetting. This'll be a whirlwind tour of most or all of those sources, with a view at helping people who would be interested in playing

title: Does Robot Wars have a Meta?
speaker: Gareth Anstee
description:
Robot Wars is a TV show that inspired a generation of engineers to take up the sport of "Robot Combat", but what drove success in the design of those competing? 

Looking at some famous matches and designs, this talk will break down the rock-paper-sciss

title: Explosion in a Tunnel; Understanding Swiss Cheese
speaker: Oliver Trojak
description: The talk takes a deep-dive into the Abbeystead explosion (using pretty much all available sources available on the subject), one of the worst civil engineering disasters in post-war history, through the lens of the HSE investigation.  It looks at what the

title: How to 3D Print A Rocket Engine
speaker: Ed Moore
description:
A talk about the state of the art with metal 3D printing, and how it can let you make rocket engines much more cheaply and quickly than ever before. 

I will briefly describe the anatomy of a rocket engine and why the extreme conditions it must endure m

title: Thomas the Privatised Tank Engine 30 years on
speaker: Ashley Rolfmore
description:
It has been 30 years since Private Eye released this biting satire of the privatisation of British Rail.

Today, the railway system is now part public part private, leaving plenty of confusion for passengers.

Who runs your local station? Who sets the

title: A country you can't put in a box.
speaker: Emily Selwood
description: A talk about the difficulties of geospatial analysis when the country you are interested is on the edge of the world map. We'll go over some background before showing what happens when you try and draw a box around this country and the issues this causes

title: How to get anything from anywhere to anywhere
speaker: Robert Nixdorf
description:
You have an object / art installation/auction purchase and want it somewhere else? What are the options of getting it there without breaking yourself?

This will be a short, hopefully entertaining, overview of transport options, their financial and envi

title: Driving fancy LED panels with commodity hardware
speaker: eta
description:
Ever wondered about what's behind large advertising billboards? Interested in pretty blinking lights? Curious about electronics and circuit board design? This talk might be for you!

Our hackspace recently got a donation of ~800 LED matrix panels (squar

title: Being Elliot Carver: How to run your own Cable TV station (or network)
speaker: Phil Pemberton
description:
There's nothing good on TV, and streaming curses you with the Paradox of Choice. So why not be Elliot Carver for a day and run your own Cable, satellite or UHF TV station - or even a whole network?
With a few low-cost computer boards (Raspberry Pi's work

title: Infrastructure Review
speaker: EMF Team
description: Members of the EMF infrastructure teams (network, power, lighting, video, telephony) will talk about how we made the event happen this year. There will be graphs.

title: Field-FX: Digital art, Demos and Prizegiving
speaker: Reality Crossley, Alex Shaw
description: Music and animation, art and code, all come together in a demoscene tradition with a history of over 40 years. It's generative art, storytelling, creative coding and more, with contributors of diverse skill levels from across the globe. We're having a par

title: HEU1993 to WHY2025: Dutch hacker camps from the past and the future
speaker: Boekenwuurm
description: The Dutch hacker camps take place between editions of EMF. They have a long history and a bright future! In this talk the Dutch camps from the past will be visited and the state of the next camp, WHY2025, will be presented.

title: Closing ceremony
speaker: EMF Team
description: The ceremony in which we close the festival. Goodbye!

title: The Rubber-Keyed Wonder
speaker: EMF Film
description: An exclusive for EMF! The Rubber Keyed Wonder is brand-new documentary that  tells the story of the Sinclair ZX Spectrum. This film goes into all the finer details of how and why the ZX Spectrum was created, what impact the computer had as well as the var

title: Funki Porcini - Vinyl DJ set
speaker: EMF Live Music
description:
Funki Porcini is composer and film maker James Braddell (a.k.a Giacomo Braddellini). His swirling mixtures of downtempo breaks, smooth ambiance, and disjointed drum'n'bass helped put the London-based Ninja Tune label on the map.

Make sure you check out

title: Vital Organs
speaker: EMF Live Music
description: Theremin, robotic carillon, sub-bass DIY bagpipes and more in this one-of-a-kind performance from humans Sarah Angliss and Karina Townsend and their extraordinary DIY machines. Hear them conjure birdsong, otherworldly voices and more as their instruments

title: Waterflower
speaker: Sabine Moore
description: Waterflower (Sabine Moore), a Latvian eco-futurist artist, creates raw, grungy electronic pop music using plants and mushrooms as instruments, reflecting on the urgency of our planet's crisis.  Working on themes of ecology, extinction and psychology, Wate

title: Silent Running
speaker: EMF Film
description: The ultimate solarpunk film? In a future Earth barren of all flora and fauna, the planet's ecosystems exist only in large pods attached to spacecraft. When word comes in that the pods are to be jettisoned into space and destroyed, most of the crew of the

title: 2xAA
speaker: EMF Live Music
description:
A Game Boy Advance fuelled chiptune dance/techno set with custom audio reactive visuals.
